Russian forces have recaptured the village of Myrne, Lyman direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~18.
Total land area: ~0.12 km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Novoselivka, Lyman direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~1,390.
Total land area: ~3.06 km¬≤.

In the Pokrovsk direction, Russian forces continued to advance towards Myrnohrad, and have entered the first houses of the city.  After securing the forests northeastern of Balahan, Russian forces began advancing through the treelines towards Kozatske, before‚Ä¶

The Ukrainian Navy published footage showing a drone-dropped explosive targeting a Russian position in the first houses of Myrnohrad. 
This is one of the many strikes I was referring to in 
this post
, where the Ukrainians are striking every occupied building one after another to eliminate the Russian presence in the city. This is also another example of Ukraine's critical manpower shortages preventing them from putting up significant resistance on the ground.

Russian forces have captured the village of Novomykolaivka, Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~457.
Total land area: ~1.43 km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Balahan, Pokrovsk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~35.
Total land area: ~0.50 km¬≤.

Earlier, a Russian Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bomb impacted the outskirts of Poltava City for the first time. The target is unknown, and no media has been published of the strike. The flight length was more than 165 km.

In the Novopavlivka direction, Russian forces have made significant progress over the past 5 days and are close to eliminating the Ukrainian salient south of Novopavlivka.
In the west, Russian forces continued to expand around the village of Filiya, and were able to collapse the Ukrainian defence northwest of Dachne by securing the treelines and then forcing the AFU to withdraw from their fortified positions in the forest. They also improved their positions to the north, capturing new treeline positions and establishing control over a gulley from the south, now coming within 1.5 km of the southern outskirts of Novopavlivka.
In the east, Russian forces continued to clear areas near the Donetsk - Dnipropetrovsk Regional Border. They captured Ukrainian positions in the treelines on the tactical heights north of Novoukrainka, before crossing over the border into the treelines northeast of Dachne, further pressuring the Ukrainian formations in the area of the highway. 
To the north, the Russians began retaking previously lost positions around Horikhove. They pushed west from the outskirts of Horikhove to the forested areas along the regional border and began clearing treelines on the tactical heights north of the village, crossing over into Dnipropetrovsk Oblast here too. 
+ ~23.68 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

On the western flank of Pokrovsk, Russian forces resumed their assault operations along the Donetsk - Dnipropetrovsk Regional Border in Molodetske, and have secured important positions south of the railway line.
After accumulating infantry, Russian forces advanced from their foothold in the southern houses of Molodetske, moving north to the railway tracks. They established full control over the village and the parallel treeline to the west and were able to secure positions in the southern railway windbreak. Other forces attacked north up a treeline towards the eastern outskirts of Molodetske, where they too reached the railway line, capturing its southern windbreak. This linked them up with formations west of Udachne, forming a unified front against the western flank of the Pokrovsk Coal Mine on the highest point of the tactical heights. 
+ ~1.15 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Pokrovsk direction, Russian forces continued their offensive in Pokrovsk and have made additional progress south of the railway line.
After securing positions in the Hospital District and the southern part of the Prospecta District, Russian forces began pushing further north. They were able to consolidate in at least 5 more blocks of the Prospecta District and continued to advance north and northwest through the Sobachivka District. 
Meanwhile, infiltrations continue towards the railway line. Russian soldiers and DRGs are operating in all parts of the city south of the tracks, including at the railway station in the city centre, and the highway overpass in the east suburbs. They are also infiltrating deeper into the northwestern industrial zone, where the grey zone now extends beyond the city limits in the direction of Hryshyne. No consolidation has occurred north of the railway line yet.
+ ~0.61 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

üáÆüá±

üáµüá∏
 ‚Äî Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu:
In response to the ceasefire violation, we attacked Hamas yesterday with 153 tons of bombs. We also hit senior commanders. 
A ceasefire is not a license to harm us. 
At the end of the process, Hamas will be eliminated politically and militarily.
@TabZLIVE

üáÆüá±
‚ùå
üáµüá∏
 ‚Äî Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu:
The government under my leadership did not accept any of Hamas's demands.
@TabZLIVE
Permanent ceasefire, am I right?

All those naive people when the war and genocide starts again will be so confused why the "peace president" couldn't stop it. 
It's almost as if Trump's plan was terribly laid out and had very few guarantees for Hamas (let alone the other Palestinian factions and movements in Gaza).
I honestly think the goal was to make a peace plan that was borderline acceptable for Hamas, but just slightly too far outside of what they could feasibly agree too, in order to portray them as unwilling to end the war and rebuild some justification for the IDF to continue their operations. 
Hamas actually accepting the deal surprised the US and Israel, so now they are relying on ceasefire violations to slowly swing back to a fighting stance.

In the Pokrovsk direction, Russian forces continued to advance towards Myrnohrad from the east and have made further progress inside the city limits. 
In the north, after establishing control over the Kapitalna Mine, Russian forces advanced down the highway to the industrial zone on the outskirts of Myrnohrad, establishing control over it. Using this to accumulate additional infantry, Russian forces broke into the northeastern suburbs of Myrnohrad, establishing control over Travnya 1 Street. Ukrainian forces withdrew from the area and are now repeating their strategy employed with the other Russian breach into the city, with striking every occupied house in an attempt to prevent consolidation and further accumulation of soldiers. In addition to this advance, the Russians were able to establish full control over the wastewater treatment plant and the surrounding areas.
To the south, after entering southeastern Myrnohrad and widening the breach in Ukrainian defences, Russian forces began attacking north into the village of Balahan. They entered the southern dachas, and pushed up into the main residential area, linking up with their formations in the forests to the east.
To the southwest, despite extensive Ukrainian FPV drone strikes, the Russians were able to consolidate further in the first houses of Myrnohrad, accumulating additional infantry for further attacks. They pushed further west down Stritenska and Syerova Streets and entered the eastern houses of Razina Street. As a result of these attacks, Russia has now secured a 1.3 km-long residential stretch of Myrnohrad, and is within 500 metres of the first high-rise residential buildings. 
+ ~2.86 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Zoomed-in maps showing the Russian breaches into northeastern and southeastern Myrnohrad.
As Ukrainian supply into the Pokrovsk salient gets worse and worse, the deepest sections of the salient will begin to collapse.

Zoomed-in maps showing the Russian breaches into northeastern and southeastern Myrnohrad.
As Ukrainian supply into the Pokrovsk salient gets worse and worse, the deepest sections of the salient will begin to collapse.
In Lviv, TCC mobilisation officers pulled a man out of an ambulance to be arrested and likely sent to the frontline.

Mutual Strikes by Ukraine and Russia: Can the Budapest Negotiations Change the Situation?
On October 18-19, Russia and Ukraine exchanged strikes. Russia targeted transport infrastructure, defense enterprises, a UAV training center, UAV workshops, an air defense radar, and Ukrainian deployment points in 156 districts. Simultaneously, the Ukrainian side attacked gas processing and oil refining facilities in several regions of Russia.
Against the backdrop of ongoing hostilities, some details emerged about the meeting between the US and Ukrainian presidents on Friday, October 17. According to the Financial Times, Donald Trump told Volodymyr Zelensky that he was losing the war and urged him to agree to Moscow‚Äôs terms to end the conflict, warning that otherwise he would be "destroyed" by Russia.

Lebanese Court Orders Release Of Gaddafi Son Who Was Abducted From Syria
A judge in Lebanon has ordered the release of Hannibal Gaddafi, the youngest son of the late Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi, on a bail of $11 million and a travel ban.
Hannibal has been held for nearly a decade in pre-trial detention in a case related to the kidnapping and disappearance of revered Lebanese Shia leader Musa al-Sadr in Libya. The bail ruling was made by Judge Zaher Hamadeh, the judicial investigator in the case of al-Sadr‚Äôs disappearance, Lebanon‚Äôs official National News Agency reported on October 17.
Al-Sadr is the founder of the Amal Movement, which is now an ally of Hezbollah. He went missing along with an aide and a journalist in 1978 when they went to meet with then-Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi.

Russian Army Is About To Trap Kiev Forces In Liman
On October 20, the Russian military advanced closer to the city of Krasny Liman in the Donetsk direction, threatening to trap Kiev forces behind the Siverskyi Donets River.
To the north of Krasny Liman, the Yug [South] Group of Forces broke through Ukrainian defenses north and west of Novoselivka, reaching the Yarova which was located right along the Siverskyi Donets. Kiev forces are almost besieged in the center and eastern parts of Novoselivka, and Russian troops are reportedly entering Yarova.
The capture of Yarova, which may be a few days away, could mark the start of the collapse of Ukrainian defenses along the river, all the way down to south of Krasny Liman, where the Yug Group of Force has also made gains.
üëâ

Russian Troops Advance In Pokrovsk And Along Yanchur Line 
On October 20, the Russian military advanced in several areas from the city of Pokrovsk in the Donetsk direction to the line along the Yanchur River in the Dnepropetrovsk direction.
To the east of Pokrovsk, the Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces began storming the southern part of Myrnohrad from nearby Balahan, which was captured very recently. It‚Äôs worth noting that Russian troops are already attempting to advance in the eastern part of the large settlement, although Ukrainian troops are still showing resistance there.
The Tsentr Group of Forces made additional gains in Pokrovsk itself, capturing the railway station building in the heart of the city.
üëâ

Israel‚Äôs Secretive Surveillance Jet Spotted Over Syria On Possible Mission Against Iran 
One of Israel‚Äôs secretive Gulfstream G550-based high-altitude surveillance aircraft was spotted flying over southern Syria on October 20, marking the first such sighting since the war with Iran in June.
A video showing the aircraft over al-Suwayda was shared by a local news blog, with activists from the governorate reporting that the aircraft was escorted by fighter jets.
The Israeli Air Force (IAF) operates two special mission versions of the G550, both were locally developed by Israel Aerospace Industries and ELTA Systems.
